title: What are some of the best country songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ah, the music of my people. When you look for good country music, you need to look everywhere but where mainstream radio country is going. Look to the past.The 1970's and 1980's are a golden age of popular country. Not only was it popular, but it was very, very good. Solid stories, innovative songwriting, a social conscience and unique voices. Kenny Rogers - The Gambler  Look further in the pastThe surviving music from the first radio stations from the 20's and 30's is solid gold. It's beautiful, simple music The Carter Family - May the Circle Be Unbroken   Look to the genresBluegrass, African American Fiddle Music, Western Swing, Americana and gospel contain some of the most under-appreciated music in the western canon. Carolina Chocolate Drops - Cornbread and Butterbeans   Look to the fringesHank I was good. Hank II was OK, Hank Williams III just doesn't give a fuck. The resurgence of rockabilly and the dirty Americana of groups like the Drive By Truckers has created some awesome music Drive-By Truckers - Bulldozers and Dirt   Look to Canada (and other countries)Canadian country music is amazing. Two examples spring to mind right away. From my neck of the woods, Corb Lund has been ripping up the touring circuit with some really amazing tunes. Another small band, $100, has this smokey voiced singer that makes my heart melt. Corb was the bassist on one of Southern Alberta's best punk/hard rock/metal bands of the 1980's, the dearly missed Smalls Corb Lund - Student Visas   Look to the ladiesOne of the most poignant areas of country music are the people that don't fit in, the people that will never get a record deal because of their sexual orientation, their look or the topic of their music. There are many, many many unappreciated female country musicians, talented guitar players and fiddlers. Just a little bit of digging, a night or two in the local live music honkey-tonk and you'll be amazed at what is singing in your ears. Mary Gautheir - I Drink

Picking one for the number one spot is is almost impossible since there are some really good country songs. I think “IT’S ONLY MAKE BELIEVE” ranks up there at the very top so I will choose this one. Originally sang by Conway Twitty, Glen Campbell does a great job. He was a great artist! It's Only Make Believe" is a song written by Jack Nance and American country music artist Conway Twitty, and produced by MGM Records' Jim Vienneau, released by Twitty as a single in July 1958. The single topped both U.S. [1] and the UK Singles Chart, [2] and was Twitty's only #1 single on the pop charts of either country. On a segment of Pop Goes The Country, Twitty states the single was a hit in 22 different countries and sold over 8 million copies. [3] It is believed that Twitty wrote his part of the song while sitting on a fire escape outside his hotel room, to escape the summer heat, in Hamilton, Ontario. Twitty had gone to Canada on the advice of another American singer, Rompin' Ronnie Hawkins, because Hawkins had told Twitty that Canada was the 'promised land' for music. [citation needed] Twitty recorded many subsequent versions of "It's Only Make Believe", including a 1970 duet with Loretta Lynn on their very first collaborative album, We Only Make Believe. Twitty joins in on the last verse in a 1988 uptempo cover by Ronnie McDowell, which was a #8 hit on the country music charts. Additionally, Twitty contributed to an alternative cover by McDowell.

This should be fun I’m only 24 so here are my top country songs. Jolene by Dolly Parton. Probably one of the first songs i ever heard as a small child my grandparents had all her Cassette tapes2. Lonely eyes by Chris Young. This song only came out in late 2014 i heard it in 2015 and memorized it so well. I feel like this is a song Conway Twitty would’ve sang in his prime mainly cause it’s about a one night stand with an attractive female that a guy meets at a bar. 3. Your man by Josh Turner. One of the best songs i can sing. 4. I see the want to in your eyes by Conway Twitty. Let’s be honest Conway twitty was a freaking savage when he wrote and sang this song only he could write a song about an attractive married women wanting him. 5. Give it away by George Strait. Again Another savage song that was funny as heck to. 6. Coat of many colors by Dolly Parton. This song is sad yet beautiful and has such a great message my favorite line of song is. They didn’t understand it and tried to make them see that one is only poor only if they choose to be. 7. Concrete angel by Martina Mcbride. A very sad song but one of my favorites 8. Three wooden crosses by Randy Travis. This song has such a powerful message if you listen to it correctly. 9. Where were you when the world stopped turning by Alan Jackson. A great post 9/11 message written in this song you can really feel Alan’s emotions when singing it. 10. The gambler by Kenny Rogers. A fun song but has a great message as well.

Here are my personal choices for the best country songs of all time.I was going to stop at the Top 10, but couldn't whittle it down that far, so you're getting the Top 30.I should really add two more to make it a Top 32.There's really no rhyme or reason for these, just songs that I crank way up when they come on my mind. 30: Tim McGraw - Live Like You Were Dying29: Hank Williams - I'm So Lonesome I Could Cry28: Dolly Parton - I Will Always Love You27: Alabama - Song of the South 26: Toby Keith - I Love This Bar25: Toby Keith - Every Dog Has It's Day24: Tim McGraw - Southern Voice23: Alan Jackson - Livin On Love22: Alan Jackson - It's Five O Clock Somewhere21: Blake shelton - Ol Red20: Kenny Chesney - Aint Back Yet19: Alan Jackson - Pop a Top Again18: Dierks bentley - What Was I Thinkin17: Diamond Rio - Meet In The middle16: Brooks & Dunn - Boot Scootin Boogie15: Brad Paisley - She's Everything14: Garth brooks - Friends In Low Places13: Garth Brooks - Aint Goin Down (Till The Sun Comes Up)12: Toby keith - Courtesy Of The Red, White, And Blue11: Kenny Chesney - I Go Back10: Kenny Chesney - No Shoes, No Shirt, No Problem  9: Alan Jackson - Small Town Southern Man  8: Jamey Johnson - In Color  7: Toby Keith - Who's Your Daddy?  6: Travis tritt - Modern Day Bonnie And Clyde  5: Alan Jackson - Where I Come From  4: Garth Brooks - That Girl Is a Cowboy  3: Brooks & Dunn - My Maria  2: Toby Keith - You Aint much Fun  1: Alan Jackson - Drive (For Daddy Gene) There are a lot of great country songs throughout the history of country music. But George Jones and Johnny Cash as far as I'm concerned have the number 1 and 2 greatest country songs of all time bar none.1. He stopped loving her today.    2. I walk the line.

I personally like Miranda Lamberts - Fastest Girl In TownThe history of the song Miranda Lambert’s 'Fastest Girl in Town’ is an energetic celebration of everything we love about this talented songwriter. It has an edgy, up-tempo vibe to it and again visits the theme of a rebel girl who loves her guns, guys and booze. Lambert co-wrote the song along with Angaleena Presley, her band mate with Pistol Annies. Apparently, 'Fastest Girl in Town’ is one of Miranda’s favorite tracks and she feels that it is an apt expression of her style. The song was released as a single in June 2012. It was also the third single from Lambert’s album Four the Record. The song describes Miranda’s relationship with her female companion as being edgy and tumultuous. They are portrayed as two rebels fleeing out in a car, constantly on the run. The final verse talks about how they are finally pulled over by a police vehicle. She charms the officer with her wily ways, and the badass girls are off on their adventure again. The song as such has been well-loved by fans and critics alike. Many were impressed by its unique musical approach that was different from the usual country style. The structure of the song has been described as four serves with two furious guitar solos in between. The absence of a bridge does not affect the song negatively in any way. One of the most famous things about the song was the appearance of female NASCAR driver Danicia Patrick in the video . In fact she plays the girl who is with Miranda during the entire video. Many critics have praised the video for its fun and creative approach. It is shot in the style of a movie with the song acting as the background music. The video starts with Miranda’s name being shown in a movie marquee, before the audience is plunged into a four-minute outlaw story of these two rebels. During the story, Lambert needs a getaway driver and the best person for the job undoubtedly is Danicia Patrick herself. She is widely regarded as the most successful women’s driver in history and her appearance in the video was definitely a bid treat for fans. The director of the video is Trey Fanjoy, who has also worked with Miranda in a number of other music videos. Blake Shelton also makes an appearance as Miranda’s love interest. Fastest Girl in Town is definitely one of Miranda’s best songs and most fans have been absolutely delighted with it. The song and video definitely go together really well. Check it out for fun and furious number.

response.upvotes: Answer requested by Pamela Lowe and Kelsey Tulare

response.answer_text: Do you mean an objective opinion because if you do I am not the one to answer this question? My likes, loves, and favorite country songs in are all tied up in emotions and mostly fond memories. I find it difficult to answer this because there are so many “best country songs”, depending on the time period. Some of the country music I loved when I was young was because my grandparents loved country and played the songs, so that was 1950’s and 1960’s into the 1970’s. Later on I liked the movies “Coal Miner’s Daughter” and “Sweet Dreams” so then I listened to Loretta Lynn’s and Patsy Cline’s music afterwards. In the 80’s I liked “Don’t Close Your Eyes” by Keith Whitley. A boyfriend of mine loved it. So then I ended up loving it. I also liked “You Never Even Called Me by My Name” by David Allan Coe and “Family Tradition” Hank William’s Jr. I love this … Waylon Jennings - "Are You Sure Hank Done It This Way" [Live from Austin, TX] Oh my, forget it! I also like so many songs by Willie Nelson and Johnny Cash. How do you chose “the best” when there are so many “best” country songs? Right now I listen to Jamey Johnson now and Chris Stapleton. I recommend watching this because two of my boyfriends loved Outlaw Country and so I was influenced to love Outlaw Country. Is it possible to even possible to pick “the best” country song? When you think of country music, who do you think of? Who comes to mind? Willie Nelson Willie Nelson - Always On My Mind (Official Music Video) I love this song by Willie Willie Nelson - Ride Me Back Home (Official Music Video)

I just started a blog that discusses one specific country song per week.  I'm hoping to reach people who have a misconception of country music (i.e that it is only about getting drunk and trucks) and bring to light some amazing songs that you won't hear on the radio today or that have been forgotten as country has progressed.  Here's the link if you'd like to check it out :)  Steel Guitars to Memphis I don't know if you're looking for old country or new country (unfortunately, there is a HUGE difference between the two) but here are some of my favorite new country artists: Kacey Musgraves I already wrote a blog post about her (Fiercer Than Miranda Lambert: "Stupid" by Kacey Musgraves) but she's simply amazing.     Ashley Monroe  Eden's Edge  David Nail Hometowns and Nostalgia: "Turning Home" by David Nail   Tim McGraw   Here are a few of my favorite classic country songs:  16 Tons- Tennessee Ernie Ford   Once a Day- Connie Smith A Milestone for Women: "Once a Day" by Connie Smith   Walking After Midnight- Patsy Cline  The Last Thing on My Mind- Dolly Parton and Porter Wagoner   Man in Black- Johnny Cash
